about.description: esys-escript is a programming tool for implementing mathematical models in python using the finite element method (FEM). As users do not access the data structures it is very easy to use and scripts can run on desktop computers as well as highly parallel supercomputer without changes. Application areas for escript include earth mantle convection, geophysical inversion, earthquakes, porous media flow, reactive transport, plate subduction, erosion, and tsunamis.
about.summary: esys-escript is a programming tool for implementing mathematical models in python using the finite element method (FEM).

name: esys-escript
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "5.4" %}

package:
    name: esys-escript
    version: {{ version }}
source:
    - url: https://launchpad.net/escript-finley/3.0+/{{ version }}/+download/python-escript_{{ version }}.tar.gz
      sha256: 61e1b3b5451d1eca06ab7c3905adfdc41906ed69e8388bfc4db094b944eb403b
      folder: escript
build:
    skip: True  # [osx]
    skip: True  # [win]
    skip: True  # [py!=27]
    number: 1
requirements:
    build:
        - {{ compiler('cxx') }}
        - svn
        - scons >3.0.5
        - cmake
        - make
        - python 2.7.*
        - llvm-openmp  # [osx]
    host:
        - boost-cpp 
        - boost
        - python 
        - suitesparse
        - matplotlib
        - gdal 
        - pyproj 
        - scipy 
        - sympy
        - llvm-openmp  # [osx]
    run:
        - boost-cpp 
        - boost
        - numpy 
        - python
        - suitesparse
        - matplotlib 
        - gdal 
        - pyproj
        - scipy
        - sympy
        - llvm-openmp  # [osx]
test:
    commands:
        - run-escript -c
        - run-escript /tmp/release_sanity.py
about:
    home: https://launchpad.net/escript-finley
    summary: esys-escript is a programming tool for implementing mathematical 
        models in python using the finite element method (FEM).
    license: Apache-2.0
    license_file: LICENSE
    description: esys-escript is a programming tool for implementing 
        mathematical models in python using the finite element method (FEM). 
        As users do not access the data structures it is very easy to use and 
        scripts can run on desktop computers as well as highly parallel
        supercomputer without changes. Application areas for escript include 
        earth mantle convection, geophysical inversion, earthquakes, 
        porous media flow, reactive transport, plate subduction, erosion, 
        and tsunamis.
    dev_url: https://launchpad.net/escript-finley
    doc_url: https://launchpad.net/escript-finley
    doc_source_url: https://launchpad.net/escript-finley

extra:
    recipe-maintainers:
        - aellery
